title: Chelsea suffer double injury blow ahead of Carabao Cup final
shortDescription: Chelsea's 2-0 win over Lille in the Champions League last-16 first leg clash was slightly overshadowed by second-half injuries to Mateo Kovacic and Hakim Ziyech.

title: Havertz points the way for Lukaku
shortDescription: Kai Havertz's performance for Chelsea against Lille only adds to the scrutiny on Romelu Lukaku.

title: Papers: £120m for Declan Rice?
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's national and international newspapers...

title: EFL highlights, round-up: Ince wins on Reading bow; Bruce's WBA lose
shortDescription: Paul Ince claims victory in first interim game in charge of Reading as they beat Birmingham 2-1, while Middlesbrough come from behind to beat West Brom 2-1.

title: Vlahovic nets after 31 secs but Juve held by Villarreal
shortDescription: Dusan Vlahovic scored the second-fastest goal ever for a Champions League debutant as his Juventus side were held to a 1-1 draw at Villarreal.

title: 'The system is failing' - Deeney wants more diverse curriculum
shortDescription: Troy Deeney has launched a petition calling for the history of Black, Asian and ethnic minorities to be made mandatory in the national curriculum.

title: Interim Ince steers Reading to victory
shortDescription: Paul Ince successfully resumed his managerial career after an absence of more than eight years when the new interim boss of Reading saw his side beat Birmingham 2-1.

title: Preston and Forest battle to draw
shortDescription: Nottingham Forest missed the chance to climb back into the Sky Bet Championship play-off places after they were held to a goalless draw by Preston at Deepdale.

title: Sunderland-Burton draw overshadowed by medical emergency
shortDescription: Ross Stewart rescued a point for Sunderland with a last gasp-header to earn a 1-1 draw with Burton in Sky Bet League One.

title: Barnsley beat Hull to claim first away win of the season
shortDescription: Basement side Barnsley left Shota Arveladze's Hull side shellshocked as they won an away game for the first time this season.

title: Boro comeback condemns Bruce's WBA to another defeat
shortDescription: Marcus Tavernier helped turn possible defeat into victory for Middlesbrough with an assist and a goal against West Brom at the Riverside.

title: Coventry snatch late win at Bristol City
shortDescription: Viktor Gyokeres kept Coventry's charge towards the Sky Bet Championship play-offs on course with an 89th-minute winner in a 2-1 victory at Bristol City.

title: Simeone: Man Utd one of best in world | Fred: We need long-term plan
shortDescription: Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone says Man Utd are one of the best teams in the world right now and it's difficult to find weaknesses in Ralf Rangnick's side.

title: Toxic carbon monoxide poisoning left Sala 'unconscious' before crash
shortDescription: Blood tests taken from the body of Emiliano Sala showed he been overcome by toxic carbon monoxide poisoning prior to his death in a plane crash, an inquest heard.

title: MPs call for Abramovich to be sanctioned
shortDescription: MPs have urged the government to impose sanctions on Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich and former Arsenal shareholder Alisher Usmanov over their links to Vladimir Putin amidst the backdrop of tensions between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Leeds identify fans on CCTV after Man Utd players struck by missiles
shortDescription: Leeds have identified a "small number of supporters" who threw objects onto the pitch during Sunday's defeat by Manchester United at Elland Road.

title: Ireland edge Wales in Pinatar Cup third-place play-off
shortDescription: Wales were beaten 1-0 by the Republic of Ireland to finish fourth in the Pinatar Cup.

title: Bruno: We have more identity under Rangnick | Unrest stories nonsense
shortDescription: Bruno Fernandes believes Manchester United have "more identity" under interim boss Ralf Rangnick and insists stories of dressing-room unrest are nonsense.

title: Conte: Kane fit to face Burnley | Kane targets Shearer record
shortDescription: Antonio Conte says Harry Kane is fit to face Burnley after the Tottenham striker suffered a knock on the back in Saturday's 3-2 win at champions Manchester City.

title: UEFA considering moving CL final | Boris: No chance Russia hosts events
shortDescription: UEFA is considering moving this season's Champions League final away from St Petersburg in response to the threat of conflict between Russia and Ukraine.
